channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13054] Provide more tracing information for locking/latching events.
item.description: Currently not much tracing information available for locking and latching events like row level locking during do mini batch mutations, region level locking during flush, close and so on. It will be better to add the trace information for such events so that it will be useful for finding time spent on locking and waiting time on locks while analyzing performance issues in queries using trace information.
item.summary: Provide more tracing information for locking/latching events.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: What you thinking?

Here is the patch just adding tracing in few places.
1) While getting a row lock possible lock contention under heavy load so just added trace info there.
2) trace info for block cache hit and scan request going through mem store.

Mostly there should not be much lock contention issues because shared locks are getting used in all most all the places. That's why not adding much tracing info.

The HRegion changes don't wrap the scope and span allocations in blocks conditional on Trace.isTracing(). We should have this there too?
Otherwise patch lgtm.
Thanks for review Andrew Purtell. Here is the patch adding Trace.isTracing check in HRegion.

This message is automatically generated.

Trace.startSpan("MemStoreScanner").close();

This should be an annotation.

traceScope.getSpan().addTimelineAnnotation("Waiting for row lock");

No need to add that annotation since that's the purpose of the span.

if (traceScope != null) traceScope.getSpan().addTimelineAnnotation("Acquired row lock");

I'd rather just annotate the failure case since that will be the more un-usual case.

Thanks for review Elliott Clark. Here is the patch addressing the comments.
If it's ok I will commit.
